paragraphs.title: Introduction

msg.data:
This notebook provides an illustrative workflow that follows the Kounkel and Covey (2019) kinematic analysis of Gaia DR2 which used unsupervised ML techniques to identify kinematic structures in five-dimensional parameter space. Steps in the analysis illustrated are:

  • Initial broad-brush selection from gaia_source from 1.7 billion rows to around 20 million;
  • further filtering of this selection on velocity with respect to the Local Standard of Rest via kinematic transformations expressed in user-defined functions;
  • transformation from Spark to Pandas data frame for input into a third-party implementation of the unsupervised ML clustering algorithm (HDBSCAN = “hierarchical density-based clustering and noise”).

paragraphs.title: Raw sample query definition
paragraphs.text:
%pyspark

# initial query on the entire catalogue: predicates come from Kounkel & Covery (2019) Section 2:
query = 'select designation, source_id, ra, ra_error, dec, dec_error, parallax, parallax_error, parallax_over_error, pmra, pmra_error, pmdec, pmdec_error, l, b ' + \
        'from gaia_source where ' + \
        'abs(b) < 30.0 AND parallax > 1.0 and parallax_over_error > 10.0 AND phot_g_mean_flux_over_error > 36.19 AND astrometric_sigma5d_max < 0.3 and ' + \
        'visibility_periods_used > 8 and (astrometric_excess_noise < 1 OR (astrometric_excess_noise > 1 AND astrometric_excess_noise_sig < 2))'
    
# define a data frame using the query string
df = spark.sql(query)

paragraphs.title: Function definitions
paragraphs.text:
%pyspark

from numpy import pi, cos, sin
import numpy as np

# Generic functions used later

def convDegRad(args, units="degrees"):
    '''
    NAME
        convDegRad
        
    FUNCTION
        args in km/sTransforms degrees to radians or returns radians if in radians
        
    INPUT
         args - list of values to convert
        units - ['degrees', 'radians'] Units of args
    
    OUTPUT
    list of args in radians
    '''

    if units == 'degrees':
        args = [i*pi/180 for i in args]

    return args

def convMasKm(args, parallax, units= 'mas/yr'):
    '''
    NAME
        convMasKm
        
    FUNCTION
        Converts data from mas/yr to km/s
        
    INPUT
            args - list of values to convert
        parallax - parallax of argsmeasurements
           units - ['mas/yr', 'km/s'] Units of args
    
    OUTPUT
        list of args in km/s
    '''
    
    if units == 'mas/yr':
        k = 4.74057
        args = [i/parallax * 4.74057 for i in args]
    elif units != 'km/s':
        raise ValueError("Input proper motion values in either mas/yr or km/s")
        
    return args

def matrix_multiplication_arrays(A,B):
    '''NAME
         matrix_multiplication_arrays
        
    FUNCTION
        Matrix multiplication of Matrix A and B if both are either lists or numpy.arrays
        
    INPUT
        A - Matrix A
        B - Matrix B
    
    OUTPUT
        MAtrix A*B, as an numpy.array
    '''
    
    if np.shape(A)[1] != np.shape(B)[0]:
        return 'Invalid matrix shape'
    else:
        n,m = np.shape(A)[0], np.shape(B)[1]
        M = np.zeros((n,m))
        
        for i in range(n):
            for j in range(len(B[0])):
                E=0
                for k in range(len(B)):
#                     print('A{}{}*B{}{}'.format(i,k,k,j))
                    E += A[i][k]*B[k][j]
                M[i,j] = E
#                 print('\n')
        return M
        
# Functions to perform the LSR cut

def create_Matrix_A(ra, dec, coord_units = 'degrees'):
    '''creates Matrix A, where A = [[cos(ra)*cos(dec), -sin(ra), -cos(ra)*sin(dec)],
                                     [sin(ra)*cos(dec),  cos(ra), -sin(ra)*sin(dec)],
                                     [sin(dec),             0,     cos(dec)]])'''
    
#     if all(v is None for v in {data, ra, dec}):
#         raise ValueError("Expected input either as array or 'ra' and 'dec' values")
#     if data is None:
#         if any(v is None for v in {ra,dec}):
#             raise ValueError("Expected input either as array or 'ra' and 'dec' values")

    ra,dec = convDegRad([ra,dec], units = coord_units)  # Ensures radians
        
    A = np.array([[cos(ra)*cos(dec), -sin(ra), -cos(ra)*sin(dec)],
              [sin(ra)*cos(dec), cos(ra), -sin(ra)*sin(dec)],
              [sin(dec), 0, cos(dec)]])
    return A

def create_matrix_C(pmra, pmdec, parallax = None, radial_velocity = 0.0, units = 'mas/yr'):
    '''creates Matrix C, where C = [radial_velocity, pmra, pmdec]'''
    
    if parallax == None and units == 'mas/yr':
        raise ValueError("Parallax value must be supplied if proper motion units are 'mas/yr'")

    pmra,pmdec = convMasKm([pmra, pmdec], parallax = parallax, units = units)  # Ensures proper motions in km/s
    C = np.array([[radial_velocity, pmra, pmdec]]).T
    
    
    return C
    
def conv_Galactic_LSR(G, magnitude = True):
    '''
    NAME
        conv_Galactic_LSR
        
    FUNCTION
        Calculates magnitude of LSR velocity give U,V,W velocity.
        
    INPUT
                G - Array of U, W, V velocity in Galactic reference frame
        Magnitude - [True, False] Return velocity magnitude (True) or LSR components (False)
    
    OUTPUT
        LSR velocity values
    
    SEE ALSO
        v_sun values from Schonrich, R., Binney, J., & Dehnen, W. 2010 | 
        DOI: 10.1111/j.1365-2966.2010.16253.x
    '''
    v_sun = [11.1, 12.24, 7.25]
    lsr = np.asarray(G).T + v_sun
    
    if magnitude == True:
        v_lsr = np.sqrt(np.sum([i**2 for i in lsr]))
        return v_lsr
    return lsr
    
def LSR_conv(ra, dec, parallax, pmra, pmdec, coord_units = 'degrees', pm_units='mas/yr', radial_velocity = 0.0, magnitude = True):
    '''
    NAME
        LSR_conv
        
    FUNCTION
        Converts proper motions from ra, dec to LSR velocity
    
    REQUIRES:
              ra - right acension of object
             dec - declination of object
        parallax - parallax of object
            pmra - right ascension component of proper motion
           pmdec - declination component of proper motion
        
    OPTIONAL:
            coord_units = [defaut = 'deg'] units of coordinates (ra, dec). 
                                Accepted values are ['deg', 'rad']
               pm_units = [defaut = 'mas/yr'] units of proper motions. 
                              Accepted values are: ['mas/yr', 'km/s']
        radial_velocity = list of radial velocity (defaults = 0.0)
                    mag = Return only V_LSR mag (default = True - returns three dimensions of v_lsr [u,v,w])
    
    RETURNS
        lsr velocity [float]
    
    SEE ALSO
         Method from: Johnson, Dean R. H., Soderblom, David R. DOI: 10.1086/114370
    '''
    
    T = [[-0.05646624, -0.87325802, -0.48397519],
         [ 0.49253617, -0.44602111,  0.74731071],
         [-0.86845823, -0.19617746,  0.4552963 ]]

    A = create_Matrix_A(ra,dec, coord_units=coord_units)   # forms Marix A
    B = matrix_multiplication_arrays(T, A)  # forms Matrix B
    
    C = create_matrix_C(pmra,pmdec,parallax, units = pm_units, radial_velocity = radial_velocity)    # forms Matrix C
    G = matrix_multiplication_arrays(B,C) # Calculates U, W, V

    v_lsr = conv_Galactic_LSR(G, magnitude = magnitude) # Calculates velocity magnitude in LSR coords
    
    return v_lsr

# This function needs to be called by the UDF, all optional parameters are set as required - e.g. show_velocity = False.

def LSR_cut(ra,dec,parallax,pmra,pmdec, 
            cut = 60, coord_units = 'degrees', 
            pm_units='mas/yr', show_velocity = False):
    '''
    NAME
        LSR_cut
        
    FUNCTION
        Calculates LSR velocity through LSR_conv and returns boolean if satisfies cut condition.
    
    REQUIRES:
              ra - right acension of object
             dec - declination of object
        parallax - parallax of object
            pmra - right ascension component of proper motion
           pmdec - declination component of proper motion
    
    OPTIONAL
          coord_units = [defaut = 'deg'] units of coordinates (ra, dec). 
                             Accepted values are ['deg', 'rad']
             pm_units = [defaut = 'mas/yr'] units of proper motions. 
                            Accepted values are: ['mas/yr', 'km/s']
        show_velocity = [default = False] print lsr velocity? [True/False]
    
    RETURNS
        [Boolean]
    '''
    
    v = LSR_conv(ra,dec,parallax,pmra,pmdec, coord_units=coord_units, pm_units=pm_units)
    if show_velocity == True:
        print(v)
    if v < cut:
        return 1
    if v > cut:
        return 0
        

from pyspark.sql.types import IntegerType

# finally, register the top-level user-defined function for inclusion in queries
spark.udf.register("udf_lsr_cut", LSR_cut, IntegerType())

paragraphs.text:
%pyspark

# apply the velocity cut to the data frame and at this point cache for downstream processing
df_lsr_cut = df.select("*").where("udf_lsr_cut(ra, dec, parallax, pmra, pmdec) = 1").cache()

# sanity check
df_lsr_cut.show()
print ("Data frame rows: ",df_lsr_cut.count())
# cf. Kounkel & Covey (2019) on DR2:
